text: Govindbhai Shekhda () was an academician, politician and activist, born in Junagadh, Gujarat, India. He earned his bachelor and master's degree in Agricultural Science at College of Agriculture. His political career spanned from a village Sarpanch to a Member of parliament for Junagadh (Lok Sabha constituency) representing Janata Dal in the 9th Lok Sabha. Later, after serving as Director of Campus for Junagadh Campus for six years he served the erstwhile Gujarat Agricultural University in the capacity of Vice chancellor.Siripurapu, S. C. B. "Special Report on 29th Annual Convention of Indian Society of Agricultural Engineers." Agricultural Engineering Today 18.1and2 (1994): 41-57, Print . Online Basu, D. N., G. S. Guha, and S. P. Kashyap. Agro-climatic Regional Planning in India: Themes and case studies. Vol. 1/2. Concept Publishing Company, 1996, His son Atul Shekhda contested as a candidate for member of parliament in the 14th Lok Sabha for Junagadh (Lok Sabha constituency).http://candidates.aamaadmiparty.org/shekhada-atulbhai- govindbhai.html However, he lost against BJP's Rajeshbhai Chudasama.http://www.ndtv.com/elections/india-mps/guj-junagadh-election- results-2014 ==References== Category:Lok Sabha members from Gujarat Category:Janata Dal politicians Category:9th Lok Sabha members Category:Year of birth missing Category:Possibly living people
title: Govindbhai Shekhda
